values.description:
**Commits**

* Add mono\_camera mesh and .sdf .config files with correct collision and inertia
* Add mono\_camera mesh to urdf file and onto WAM-V
* Integrate sensor post to camera urdf, with height parameter
* Add adjustment link and joint to make the camera frame match base frame
* Simplify all transformations: base->post->arm->camera

This PR is very similar to the **Issue~~#86~~ add 3d lidar mesh** PR. It uses the same sensor post \+ sensor post arm setup, but instead has a camera mesh.

**Images**

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3854322670-Default_Camera_Poses.png)
  
_Figure 1: Default camera positions_

---

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/1684716592-Close_up_Camera.png)
  
_Figure 2: Close up view of cameras_

---

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/1148934140-Cameras_with_Roll.png)
  
_Figure 3: Cameras with 15 degrees of roll. y="-0.1" x="0.75" R="$\{radians\(15\)\}_

---

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/964520771-Camera_Inertia.png)
  
_Figure 4: Camera inertia modeled as box_

---

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/1221590226-Camera_Collision.png)
‌

  
_Figure 5: Camera collision modeled as cylinder and box_

---

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3940807887-Camera_with_Yaw.png)
  
_Figure 6: 45 degree yaw camera and post. y="-0.45" P="0" Y="$\{radians\(-45\)\}" post\_Y="$\{radians\(-45\)\}"_

---

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3679749829-Pointing_Backwards_Camera.png)
  

_Figure 7: Camera pointing backwards. Chosen camera yaw is independent of post\_Y. y="-0.45" P="0" Y="$\{radians\(-180\)\}" post\_Y="$\{radians\(-45\)\}"_
values.title: Issue#85 add monocular camera mesh

The default branch is not building on the most recent merge. I believe this is due to a small implementation detail with the ignition::math::Vector3d windDirection in usv\_gazebo\_wind\_plugin.cc. It’s x,y,z components cannot only be read with the \[\] operator, but not changed.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/473134760-lvalue_required.png)
![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/2299745139-Default_Branch_Not_Building.png)

values.description:
This PR is based on the earlier contribution from [PR #78](#!/osrf/vrx/pull-requests/78/issue-23-coordinate-the-physics-and/diff) that began to address [Issue #23](#!/osrf/vrx/issues/23/coordinate-the-physics-and-visualization) for synchronizing the visual and physical wave fields.  Based on that initial work I’ve connected the method with our WAM-V dynamics and general purpose buoyancy plugins.  

This also implements an additional method for generating the component waves based on a standard family of oceanographic wave spectra.  

Added documentation: 

* [Wavefield Implementation](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/documentation/wavefield_generation): How the model is implemented to keep the visual and physical models in sync.
* [Wavefield Envelope](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/documentation/wavefield_envelope): Describes the ranges of wavefield parameters for VRX with examples of different seastates and how we measure consistency of the visual and physical models.
values.title: New wave generation model and implementation.

summary.html:
This PR is based on the earlier contribution from PR #78 that began to address Issue #23 for synchronizing the visual and physical wave fields. Based on that initial work I’ve connected the method with our WAM-V dynamics and general purpose buoyancy plugins.

This also implements an additional method for generating the component waves based on a standard family of oceanographic wave spectra.

Added documentation:

  • Wavefield Implementation: How the model is implemented to keep the visual and physical models in sync.
  • Wavefield Envelope: Describes the ranges of wavefield parameters for VRX with examples of different seastates and how we measure consistency of the visual and physical models.

values.description:
**Description of Issue**

We’d like to extend both the [usv\_gazebo\_thrust\_plugin](#!/osrf/vrx/src/default/usv_gazebo_plugins/src/usv_gazebo_thrust_plugin.cc) Gazebo model plugin and the [engine.xacro](#!/osrf/vrx/src/default/wamv_description/urdf/engine.xacro) model so that users can change the thrust angle via a ROS API.

* The thrust plugin would subscribe to a ROS topic, e.g., “left\_ thrust\_angle”, that would set the angular displacement of the thruster.

    * The angle, in radians, would be relative to the nominal thruster attitude.
    
* The configuration should allow for angle limits \(e.g., \+/- pi/2\) to be set.
* A new rotation joint should be included in the engine model to facilitate the rotation

    * The plugin would also set the joint rotation so that the visual model reflects the vectored thrust.
    

**Design Questions**

1. How should max angle be set? Currently done by changing `<maxAngle>NUMBER</maxAngle>` in `wamv_gazebo_thruster_config.xacro`
2. Thrust commands currently have a `lastCmdTime` to track the time of last command signal and a `cmdTimeout` to describe how long each command should last for before not putting a force anymore. Should there be something similar for angle? eg. if publish `left_thrust_angle=pi/3` and then stop publishing angle, should the angle remain pi/3 until set otherwise, or should it “reset” back to `left_thrust_angle=0` if it does not receive angle messages? Currently there is no “reset”, it remains at the last published angle
3. What to do if |published angle| > maxAngle? eg. if publish `left_thrust_angle=5*pi/4`, but we have `<maxAngle>${pi/2}</maxAngle>`, what should it do? Output error/warning message and ignore message \(keep same angle as it previously was\)? Or clip it \(if it is >pi/2, then clip to pi/2. If it is <-pi/2, then clip to -pi/2\).
4. If published angle = 7\*pi/4 and maxAngle=pi/2, should this be interpreted as -pi/4 or clipped to pi/2 or output error message and ignore? Currently doing clipping.
values.title: Issue#96 Add Thrust Angle and Rotation Joint

Currently there is no “reset”, it remains at the last published angle

summary.html:
Description of Issue

We’d like to extend both the usv_gazebo_thrust_plugin Gazebo model plugin and the engine.xacro model so that users can change the thrust angle via a ROS API.

  • The thrust plugin would subscribe to a ROS topic, e.g., “left_ thrust_angle”, that would set the angular displacement of the thruster.

    • The angle, in radians, would be relative to the nominal thruster attitude.

  • The configuration should allow for angle limits (e.g., +/- pi/2) to be set.

  • A new rotation joint should be included in the engine model to facilitate the rotation

    • The plugin would also set the joint rotation so that the visual model reflects the vectored thrust.

Design Questions

  1. How should max angle be set? Currently done by changing <maxAngle>NUMBER</maxAngle> in wamv_gazebo_thruster_config.xacro
  2. Thrust commands currently have a lastCmdTime to track the time of last command signal and a cmdTimeout to describe how long each command should last for before not putting a force anymore. Should there be something similar for angle? eg. if publish left_thrust_angle=pi/3 and then stop publishing angle, should the angle remain pi/3 until set otherwise, or should it “reset” back to left_thrust_angle=0 if it does not receive angle messages? Currently there is no “reset”, it remains at the last published angle
  3. What to do if |published angle| > maxAngle? eg. if publish left_thrust_angle=5*pi/4, but we have <maxAngle>${pi/2}</maxAngle>, what should it do? Output error/warning message and ignore message (keep same angle as it previously was)? Or clip it (if it is >pi/2, then clip to pi/2. If it is <-pi/2, then clip to -pi/2).
  4. If published angle = 7*pi/4 and maxAngle=pi/2, should this be interpreted as -pi/4 or clipped to pi/2 or output error message and ignore? Currently doing clipping.

values.description:
‌

* filled out the SensorCompliance. It is formatted by the sensors\_compliance files
* styling
* added roslaunch params

thruster bounding boxes visualized

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3286679424-thrusters.png)
  
sensor bounding boxes visualized

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/482578878-comp_show.png)
number test and permitted parameters are configured by sensor\_compliance/numeric.yaml and thruster\_compliance/numeric.yaml

bounding boxes are configured by

sensor\_compliance/visual.sdf and thruster\_compliance/visual.sdf

example yamls:

sensor\_num\_fail will fail because too many cameras

```
wamv_camera:
    - name: front_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.3
      z: 2
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: front_left_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.1
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: front_right_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: -0.1
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: middle_right_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.3
      P: ${radians(15)}
wamv_gps:
    - name: gps_wamv
      x: -0.85
      z: 1.75
wamv_imu:
    - name: imu_wamv
      x: 1
      y: -0.2
wamv_p3d:
    - name: p3d_wamv
wamv_3d_lidar:
    - name: lidar_wamv
      P: ${radians(8)}
```

sensor\_bounding fail will fail because one of the cameras is not in bounds:

```
wamv_camera:
    - name: front_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.3
      z: 2
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: front_left_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.1
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: front_right_camera
      x: 2
      y: -0.1
      P: ${radians(15)}
wamv_gps:
    - name: gps_wamv
      x: -0.85
      z: 1.75
wamv_imu:
    - name: imu_wamv
      x: 1
      y: -0.2
wamv_p3d:
    - name: p3d_wamv
wamv_3d_lidar:
    - name: lidar_wamv
      P: ${radians(8)}
```

sensors config will work:

```
wamv_camera:
    - name: front_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.3
      z: 2
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: front_left_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: 0.1
      P: ${radians(15)}
    - name: front_right_camera
      x: 0.75
      y: -0.1
      P: ${radians(15)}
wamv_gps:
    - name: gps_wamv
      x: -0.85
      z: 1.75
wamv_imu:
    - name: imu_wamv
      x: 1
      y: -0.2
wamv_p3d:
    - name: p3d_wamv
wamv_3d_lidar:
    - name: lidar_wamv
      P: ${radians(8)}
```

thruster\_config will not fail:

```
engine:
    - prefix: "left"
      position: "-2.373776 1.027135 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "right"
      position: "-2.373776 -1.027135 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "middle"
      position: "-2.373776 0 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
```

thruster\_config\_num\_fail will fail due too too any engines

```
engine:
    - prefix: "aft_port"
      position: "-2.373776 1.027135 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "aft_star"
      position: "-2.373776 -1.027135 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "aft_center"
      position: "-2.373776 0 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "for_port"
      position: "1 .8 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "for_star"
      position: "1 -.8 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
```

thruster\_config\_bounding\_fail will fail due too bounding box:

```
engine:
    - prefix: "left"
      position: "-2.373776 1.027135 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "right"
      position: "-2.373776 -1.027135 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"
    - prefix: "middle"
      position: "2.373776 0 0.318237"
      orientation: "0.0 0.0 0.0"wamv
```

values.description:
This PR simplifies the wave\_visualization branch

* Removes the gazebo messaging \(request and response\) between the visual and model plugin

    * Removing this functionality introduces an annoyance.  In [ocean\_waves model.sdf](#!/osrf/vrx/src/0e04fed55abd46ab811aa63823bddb9bdc830b7b/wave_gazebo/world_models/ocean_waves/model.sdf) we have to define the wave parameters separately for the model plugin and the visual plugin.
    
* The shared pointer \(shared between the ocean model plugin and the USV and/or buoyancy plugins\) is now constant.  This did not have a measurable performance effect.

Overall, this simplifies the code, but doesn’t appear to have a performance benefit.
values.title: Wave visual / physics refactor

summary.raw:
This PR simplifies the wave\_visualization branch

* Removes the gazebo messaging \(request and response\) between the visual and model plugin

    * Removing this functionality introduces an annoyance.  In [ocean\_waves model.sdf](#!/osrf/vrx/src/0e04fed55abd46ab811aa63823bddb9bdc830b7b/wave_gazebo/world_models/ocean_waves/model.sdf) we have to define the wave parameters separately for the model plugin and the visual plugin.
    
* The shared pointer \(shared between the ocean model plugin and the USV and/or buoyancy plugins\) is now constant.  This did not have a measurable performance effect.

Overall, this simplifies the code, but doesn’t appear to have a performance benefit.
summary.html:
This PR simplifies the wave_visualization branch

  • Removes the gazebo messaging (request and response) between the visual and model plugin

    • Removing this functionality introduces an annoyance. In ocean_waves model.sdf we have to define the wave parameters separately for the model plugin and the visual plugin.

  • The shared pointer (shared between the ocean model plugin and the USV and/or buoyancy plugins) is now constant. This did not have a measurable performance effect.

Overall, this simplifies the code, but doesn’t appear to have a performance benefit.

values.description: This very small PR addresses issue #110. The sampleCount variable was defined as a double and not initialized, causing the rms\_error calculation to yield nan, which was being broadcast the the rms\_error topic. Changing to an unsigned int and initializing to 0 resolves the problem.
values.title: Fixing rms_error calculation

summary.raw: This very small PR addresses issue #110. The sampleCount variable was defined as a double and not initialized, causing the rms\_error calculation to yield nan, which was being broadcast the the rms\_error topic. Changing to an unsigned int and initializing to 0 resolves the problem.
summary.html: This very small PR addresses issue #110. The sampleCount variable was defined as a double and not initialized, causing the rms_error calculation to yield nan, which was being broadcast the the rms_error topic. Changing to an unsigned int and initializing to 0 resolves the problem.

values.description:
Closes #94

* Implemented buoyancy using submerged volume for cube, cylinder, and sphere. Cube and cylinder submerged volume is calculated by converting it into a polyhedron. Sphere submerged volume is calculated using integration.
* Implemented linear and angular drag for objects
* Unit tests for submerged volume calculation
* Demo world

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/860917265-ezgif.com-optimize.gif)

values.description:
**Commits**

* Publish joint state for chassis engine joint to fix tf tree issue
* Refactor SpinPropeller to be more clear and match style of RotateEngine

**Instructions**

Currently, when running any boat launch file, the thrusters are not connected to the base link in the tf tree. This can be shown by running the following commands.

1. `roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch`
2. `rosrun robot_state_publisher robot_state_publisher`
3. `rosrun rqt_tf_tree rqt_tf_tree`
values.title: Issue#124 missing base to thruster tf

values.description:
Minor changes to make our plugin messages more uniform. These are not critical, but are helpful for running the initial tutorials and for debugging:

* added a gzmsg indicating the current state to scoring\_plugin parent class implementation of OnReady, OnRunning, OnFinished
* added a gzmsg where missing to overriden methods
* clean up: removed overriden methods from plugins that made no alterations from parent class

If there is a reason to keep overriden methods that don’t implement changes \(for example, future plans\), it’s easy to put them back in.
values.title: Make gz messages more uniform across plugins

values.description:
This PR changes the OnUpdate method so it checks the time associated with objects to be spawned against the time since the plugin transitioned to the running state. 

* The times given in the <time> element in the model are now interpreted as simulation times relative to the task elapsed time, rather than relative to the start of the last trial. 
* The default values used in our example have been updated accordingly.
values.title: Fix Issue #126: perception task starts before running state

values.description:
In going through tutorial [#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/ChangingPluginParameters](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/ChangingPluginParameters) realized that our `var_gain` parameter is a bit non-intuitive to specify.  The `var_gain` parameter now sets the RMS value \(~standard deviation\) of the variable component of the wind, so setting it to 8 m/s gives a variable wind \(gust\) component with a standard deviation of 8 m/s.  

This also sets the default value of the wind in the plugin to be zero.
values.title: Reinterpret the wind 'gain' parameter.

The `var_gain` parameter now sets the RMS value \(~standard deviation\) of the variable component of the wind, so setting it to 8 m/s gives a variable wind \(gust\) component with a standard deviation of 8 m/s.

summary.html:
In going through tutorial #!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/ChangingPluginParameters realized that our var_gain parameter is a bit non-intuitive to specify. The var_gain parameter now sets the RMS value (~standard deviation) of the variable component of the wind, so setting it to 8 m/s gives a variable wind (gust) component with a standard deviation of 8 m/s.

This also sets the default value of the wind in the plugin to be zero.

values.description:
* branch
* added a space parameter to the bounding boxes

This pull request addresses some of the points brought up by Brian this week.

1. In this branch, the bounding boxes are specified as yamls and a field capacity can be specified -1 for unlimited or some positive integer for the number of things that can go in that box

‌

2\. The bounding boxes for thrusters have been moved to look like: 

‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/1316546505-new_thruster_bounds.png)
‌

3\. The generate\_wamv.launch now has default parameters for the example yaml config files located in vrx\_gazebo/src/vrx\_gazebo\_python/generator\_scripts/wamv\_config \(also the example\_thrusters\_config.yaml now generates an H config\)

‌

4\. why configure\_wamv.py is written as a ROS node?

Good parameters passing and directory searching.

Easy to launch with right parameters from other launch file if we ever wanted to do that.

‌

5\.

values.description:
This is a proposed set of changes that would alter the default WAMV to have it’s topics reorganised into namespaces based on type, including sensors, cameras and thrusters.  A global namespace is set using the spawn\_models namespace capability that would allow multiple robots to be run in a single simulation.

* Created new branch topic\_namespace\_generation
* Add support for namespaces This includes thruster, camera and sensor namespaces, as well as a global namespace allowing multiple vehicles to be created without causing interference.
* Add sensor namepsace to planar lidar Remove gloabl namespace
* Fix namepsaces to work with robotNamespace parameter
values.title: Topic namespace generation

values.description:
Note: This PR does not necessarily need to be merged in, but should be discussed.

**Description**

This PR is to discuss the `enable_ros_network` argument, which is described below.

For the purpose of competition, we need to limit the exposed ROS and Gazebo topics to the ones that competitors should be able to use. There are three types:

1. Gazebo transport topics - being solved by Docker containers that have no Gazebo transport topic communication
2. ROS VRX topics - these can be hidden by setting an environment variable \(should already be set\)
3. ROS topics with gazebo namespace - \(eg. /gazebo/model\_states\). This should be handled by `enable_ros_network` parameter for Gazebo. 

**Issue**

This should work, but the only issue is that we call `spawn_model` in launch files to spawn the WAM-V. However, this uses one of the topics hidden by `enable_ros_network:=false`. Source code: [https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo\_ros\_pkgs/blob/melodic-devel/gazebo\_ros/scripts/spawn\_model](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/melodic-devel/gazebo_ros/scripts/spawn_model)

**Question**

Can we change how we spawn the model or do we have to make another branch of Gazebo?

Also, should we even keep this argument, or should we just manually add it to `extra_gazebo_args`?
values.title: Add enable_ros_network argument

Note: This PR does not necessarily need to be merged in, but should be discussed.

**Description**

This PR is to discuss the `enable_ros_network` argument, which is described below.

For the purpose of competition, we need to limit the exposed ROS and Gazebo topics to the ones that competitors should be able to use. There are three types:

1. Gazebo transport topics - being solved by Docker containers that have no Gazebo transport topic communication
2. ROS VRX topics - these can be hidden by setting an environment variable \(should already be set\)
3. ROS topics with gazebo namespace - \(eg. /gazebo/model\_states\). This should be handled by `enable_ros_network` parameter for Gazebo. 

**Issue**

This should work, but the only issue is that we call `spawn_model` in launch files to spawn the WAM-V. However, this uses one of the topics hidden by `enable_ros_network:=false`. Source code: [https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo\_ros\_pkgs/blob/melodic-devel/gazebo\_ros/scripts/spawn\_model](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/melodic-devel/gazebo_ros/scripts/spawn_model)

summary.html:
Note: This PR does not necessarily need to be merged in, but should be discussed.

Description

This PR is to discuss the enable_ros_network argument, which is described below.

For the purpose of competition, we need to limit the exposed ROS and Gazebo topics to the ones that competitors should be able to use. There are three types:

  1. Gazebo transport topics - being solved by Docker containers that have no Gazebo transport topic communication
  2. ROS VRX topics - these can be hidden by setting an environment variable (should already be set)
  3. ROS topics with gazebo namespace - (eg. /gazebo/model_states). This should be handled by enable_ros_network parameter for Gazebo.

Issue

This should work, but the only issue is that we call spawn_model in launch files to spawn the WAM-V. However, this uses one of the topics hidden by enable_ros_network:=false. Source code: https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/melodic-devel/gazebo_ros/scripts/spawn_model

Question

Can we change how we spawn the model or do we have to make another branch of Gazebo?

Also, should we even keep this argument, or should we just manually add it to extra_gazebo_args?
